About This Game

Dishonored is an immersive first-person action game that casts you as a supernatural assassin driven by revenge. With Dishonored’s flexible combat system, creatively eliminate your targets as you combine the supernatural abilities, weapons and unusual gadgets at your disposal. Pursue your enemies under the cover of darkness or ruthlessly attack them head on with weapons drawn. The outcome of each mission plays out based on the choices you make.

Story:

Dishonored is set in Dunwall, an industrial whaling city where strange steampunk- inspired technology and otherworldly forces coexist in the shadows. You are the once-trusted bodyguard of the beloved Empress. Framed for her murder, you become an infamous assassin, known only by the disturbing mask that has become your calling card. In a time of uncertainty, when the city is besieged by plague and ruled by a corrupt government armed with industrial technologies, dark forces conspire to bestow upon you abilities beyond those of any common man – but at what cost? The truth behind your betrayal is as murky as the waters surrounding the city, and the life you once had is gone forever.

Key features:

  • Improvise and Innovate

    Approach each assassination with your own style of play. Use shadow and sound to your advantage to make your way silently through levels unseen by foes, or attack enemies head-on as they respond to your aggression. The flexible combat system allows you to creatively combine your abilities, supernatural powers and gadgets as you make your way through the levels and dispatch your targets. Improvise and innovate to define your play style.
  • Action with Meaning

    The world of Dishonored reacts to how you play. Move like a ghost and resist corruption, or show no mercy and leave a path of destruction in your wake. Decide your approach for each mission, and the outcomes will change as a result.
  • Supernatural Abilities

    Teleport for stealth approaches, possess any living creature, or stop time itself to orchestrate unearthly executions! Combining your suite of supernatural abilities and weapons opens up even more ways to overcome obstacles and eliminate targets. The game’s upgrade system allows for the mastery of deadly new abilities and devious gadgets.
  • A City Unlike Any Other

    Enter an original world envisioned by Half-Life 2 art director Viktor Antonov. Arkane and Bethesda bring you a steampunk city where industry and the supernatural collide, creating an atmosphere thick with intrigue. The world is yours to discover.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows Vista / Windows 7
    • Processor: 3.0 GHz dual core or better
    • Memory: 3 GB system RAM
    • Hard Disk Space: 9 GB
    • Video Card: DirectX 9 compatible with 512 MB video RAM or better (NVIDIA GeForce GTX 460 / ATI Radeon HD 5850)
    • Sound: Windows compatible sound card
    Recommended:
    • OS: Windows Vista / Windows 7 (enhanced for 64-bit OS)
    • Processor: 2.4 GHz quad core or better (enhanced for multi-core processors)
    • Memory: 4 GB system RAM
    • Hard Disk Space: 9 GB
    • Video Card: DirectX 9 compatible with 768 MB video RAM or better (NVIDIA GeForce GTX 460 / ATI Radeon HD 5850)
    • Sound: Windows compatible sound card

大名 Tanegashima
150 products in account
10 reviews
Recommended
22.3 hrs on record
Posted: June 24
Dishonored is inspired by the late nineteenth-century London and Edinburgh atmosphere that puts players in the skin of an empresses bodyguard named Corvo, who is framed for her murder and forced to become an assassin seeking revenge on those who conspired against him.

An excellent example of what a good adventure and a first-person action game should be, Dishonored can count itself as one of the top games of its many genres.

Overall aspects of Dishonored

Storyline plus the adventure:

The storyline in Dishonored is solid without losing its flexibility and well-constructed, being more than capable of giving players a very deep and easy understanding of it as it drastically changes or gets either molded by the players progression.

The characters couldn’t have been better selected. Everyone’s characteristics and roles match perfectly with the game's storyline and the situation that is present resulting in a very pleasant experience for those who wish to be part of a high quality story full of events and changes.

The adventure in Dishonored is something to admire. Despite being at its first look a game that resumes into successfully assassinate traitors and murderers, Dishonored offers in each mission a huge vast variety of ways on how to succeed in them.
Without mentioning the numerous side quests and other characters you may encounter, contributing to an extended exploration and adventure that may or not, again, affect your main quest storyline.

Graphics and game play mechanics:

Dishonored uses the Unreal Engine 3, with a huge inspiration from the Victorian-Era world of England during the late 19th century.

The game's graphics despite not being cutting-edge or breath-taking, match perfectly well with the game overall environment and the time period it has been designed in.

The game play mechanics might look at first slightly complex or confusing due to the huge amount of ways and styles that allows players to choose and adapt in each given situation depending on the creativity and style of each player. Such complexity can be easily be turn into something simple as players get the hand of the game and get used to it with a bit of time invested in it.

User interface:

The user interface is simple, clean and it can be easily mastered in a short period of time despite having a fairly wide variety of weaponry which also includes magic.

Music and the voice acting:

The music is mostly atmospheric sounds that match up fairly well with each situation and stage that the game presents.

The voice acting is formidable, it successfully combines the voice in each character to his or her role, to their physical characteristics and way of thinking.

Game difficulty:

The game difficulty is very well balanced to meet the tastes of those who wish an enjoyable adventure without struggling that much, to those who want it hardcore with difficult and sharper opponents.

Price:

The game price I would say is reasonable. A polished game with a high quality adventure with a beautiful story without any bugs/problems to point out.

Despite being only a single player game, I personally believe it deserves its base price.

DLC's

Dishonored has a few DLC's with the purpose of expanding the existing single player game play/campaign for a very balanced price making them worth every cent you spend on.

Conclusion

I would rate this game a 89 out of 100 or 4.5 out of 5.0 stars. A game that combines a good storyline, adventure and combat game play mechanics perfectly, making you ask for more and more of it.

Rasmus ರ.=.ರೃ
98 products in account
3 reviews
Recommended
196.6 hrs on record
Posted: June 24
With the announcement of DH2, i thought i'd review one of my long time favourite Action/Stealth games. Might or might not contain story spoilers.

Dishonored is a First-Person stealth/action game that is in a Victorian world mixed with very steampunkish things, such as very clunky machinery powered by "Whale Oil" harvested from whales. or as some call it, "Whalepunk"

You play as Corvo Attano, the former bodyguard and Lord Protector of the Empress of the Isles, who is framed for the assassination of the empress and kidnapping the empress daughter Emily, and now after getting out of prison thanks to your mutual friends, you become an assassin with exceptional talents, tasked with taking out the people who conspired against you and your beloved empress, and find emily and place her on the throne, getting various new supernatural abilites and gadgets along the way.

The Gameplay of Dishonored is very fluid and flexible, giving you a large variety of options how to approach your mission, silent and surgical, only taking out your target and not being seen, or just stomping straight through the front, killing anyone unlucky enough to try to cross your path. You can upgrade and build your abilities to your liking and playstyle, was it that you wanted to just knock out neutralize your target, or brutally rip your enemies to shreds with swarms of rats, or really anything in the between. It's all up to you. The stealth mechanics are pretty great, AI isnt dumb, especially on the hardest difficulty, except for that one feature, the lean, which obviously allows you to lean to look from corners, but still cannot be spotted by doing that, even if you're sticking your ugly head out.

The artstyle, character designs and world of Dishonored are one of my favourites of all time. Steampunk mixed with Victorian age art, such as the guard outfits, cities and houses, interors, machines and more.
Dishonored 
A Screenshot of Dishonored
By: Critical Erin

The World of DH is very dark, Dunwall ravaged by a rat plague, sick and poor in the streets and guards abusing the weak, the rich living without a care in the world.
Enemies vary between areas and levels, from the normal City Watch guards to the big machine riding Tallboys all with their own abilities.

The soundtrack and sounds of Dishonored are very good in my opinion, the music immersing you with that bleak and dark city of Dunwall as you skulk your way across those dark alleyways and bright ledges of brothels looking to drive your sword into someone's neck to avenge your beloved.

The DLC that this game contains is actually mostly as great as the main game, the 2 pieces of downloadable content that in you play as the Master Assassin Daud who killed the Empress, but having regrets over it even after many long years of assassinations for his living. You get a brand new arsenal of abilites and weapons, from stun mines to summoning your assassin minions to help you in battle.. or distract guards for as long as you need to get past. In my opinion, the DLC story pieces are better than the main game. the rest isnt very significant, the challenges are cool and fun to kill time with, althought sometimes quite hard.

Great story, artstyle and music, lots of variations and not a lot of flaws, which makes Dishonored a great purchase and a very good stealth assassination game.

Knalraap @Aerie
413 products in account
30 reviews
Recommended
20.2 hrs on record
Posted: June 23
What a fool I was.. I pre-ordered this game back in 2012, the trailer gripped me and the screenshots got me pumped... and then I never played it, until recently.

I really can't believe that I didn't pay attention to this masterpiece of a game for 3 years, it's up there with Bioshock and Half Life for me.

The very first thing that will grip you as you play is the unique world and amazing atmosphere, the game is set in an industrial steampunk city that resembles victorian London, struck by a mysterious plague.. it's dark, it's gloomy and it's beautiful.

There's a genuis blend of technology and magic in your arsenal and in the world around you, I lightly compare this game to Bioshock because as you progress you will unlock supernatural powers which you can use together with your weapons, you'll be able to bend time, teleport onto rooftops and even posses enemies and animals.
And that's why I like Dishonored so much more than other stealth-focussed games, thanks to all these powers and weapons/gadgets you can go through a level in countless ways be it slipping through undetected or murdering everyone who crosses your path.

Even better is that how you play the game actually carries weight, if you wreak havoc wherever you go the city will become even more chaotic and you'll become more notorious. There's a great amount of player choice in this game, whenever you are asked to eliminate key targets there will be multiple paths you can follow, some even non-lethal, you can literally play the entire game without killing anyone.

The only minor point of criticism I have is the length of the game, just as I got really immersed I was already nearing the end, and once I beat the game I was longing for more though luckly there is DLC which is really good as well and this game definitely has a load of replayability considering of all the different playstyles and loads of collectibles in the world.

I still can't believe I let this game sit in my library for 3 years, it's absolutely worth playing!
